extends java.lang.Object

      Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the size (number of character elements) of a block in the current disk instance.

      Returns a nonnegative integer value corresponding to the number of valid blocks (unused + used) that the current disk instance has.

      Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the first block in the collection of free data blocks in the current disk instance.

      Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the index of the first free block in the current disk instance.

      Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the index of the first free i-node in the list of free i-nodes in the current disk instance.

      Returns the first free i-node index in the list of free i-nodes for file or directory assignment.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(int blockNum,
                  VirtualDiskBlock b)
           throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                  InvalidBlockException
        Writes the content of block b into the disk block corresponding to blockNum.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - is the number corresponding to the location of the disk block that b will overwrite.
        b - is the disk block to be written on.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever the block number received is not valid for the current disk instance.
        InvalidBlockException - whenever b does not represent a valid disk block for the current disk instance.

      • read

        public void read(int blockNum,
                 VirtualDiskBlock b)
          throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                 InvalidBlockException
        Reads the given block parameter from the disk.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - is the number corresponding to the location of disk block b.
        b - is the disk block to read.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever the block number received is not valid for the current disk instance.
        InvalidBlockException - whenever b does not represent a valid disk block for the current disk instance.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns a nonnegative integer value corresponding to the number of valid blocks (unused + used) that the current disk instance has.
        Returns:
        the number of valid blocks

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the size (number of character elements) of a block in the current disk instance.
        Returns:
        the size of the block

      • getFirstFreeBlock

        public int getFirstFreeBlock()
        Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the first block in the collection of free data blocks in the current disk instance.
        Returns:
        the first free block

      • getFirstFreeBlockIndex

        public int getFirstFreeBlockIndex()
        Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the index of the first free block in the current disk instance.
        Returns:
        the index of the first free block

      • getFirstFreeINodeIndex

        public int getFirstFreeINodeIndex()
        Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the index of the first free i-node in the list of free i-nodes in the current disk instance.
        Returns:
        the first free i-node

      • getNumOfINodes

        public int getNumOfINodes()
        Returns a nonnegative integer value which corresponds to the total number of i-nodes in the current disk instance.
        Returns:
        the number of i-nodes

      • getFreeINode

        public int getFreeINode()
                 throws FullDiskException
        Returns the first free i-node index in the list of free i-nodes for file or directory assignment. Next free i-node becomes the first free i-node.
        Returns:
        the first free i-node in the list of free i-nodes
        Throws:
        FullDiskException - if pointer to next free i-node is 0.

      • getFreeBlockNumber

        public int getFreeBlockNumber(java.io.RandomAccessFile disk,
                              int blockSize)
        Returns the reference to the most recent free block in the disk.
        Parameters:
        disk - the disk from where the free block will be returned
        blockSize - the size of the blocks in the disk
        Returns:
        the reference to the first 4 bytes of the free block

      • lowLevelFormat

        public void lowLevelFormat()
        Formats the disk. This operation visits every “physical block” in the disk and fills with zeroes all those that are valid.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Simulates shutting-off the disk. Just closes the corresponding RAF.

      • registerFreeBlock

        public static void registerFreeBlock(java.io.RandomAccessFile disk,
                                     int bn,
                                     int blockSize)
        Writes a free block into the tree-like structure of free blocks in the disk.
        Parameters:
        disk - the disk that will register the blocks
        bn - the reference for the block to register
        blockSize - the size of each block in the disk

      • mount

        public static DiskUnit mount(java.lang.String name)
                      throws NonExistingDiskException
        Turns on an existing disk unit whose name is given. If successful, it makes the particular disk unit available for operations suitable for a disk unit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the disk unit to activate
        Returns:
        the corresponding DiskUnit object
        Throws:
        NonExistingDiskException - whenever no ¨disk¨ with the specified name is found.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ExistingDiskException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as having default capacity (number of blocks), each of default size (number of bytes). Those values are: DEFAULT_CAPACITY and DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE. The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name,
                                  int capacity,
                                  int blockSize)
                           throws ExistingDiskException,
                                  java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as with the specified capacity (number of blocks), each of specified size (number of bytes). The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        capacity - number of blocks in the new disk
        blockSize - size per block in the new disk
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - whenever the values for capacity or blockSize are not valid according to the specifications
